info.description: API for Aspera Node Management and Transfer Support
info.title: Node API

tags.name: /access_keys
tags.description: Create and manage access keys for High-Speed Transfer Server, Aspera on Demand, and Aspera on Cloud transfer service. Access keys enable tenant-level access control over a given storage. Use access keys for authorization if the client application interacts with the Node API through a server application broker. Authenticate with an access key or Node API credentials. The creator of the access key must be authorized to access the storage path that is specified in the access key configuration.

tags.name: /events
tags.description: Get event activity information of a node including file transfer, creation, modification, and deletion; file permission creation, modification, and deletion; and filelock creation, modification, reversion, and deletion. Authentication with Node API credentials or an access key ID and secret allows you to see any event in the same tenant space. Bearer token users can see any event associated with a file ID to which they have any permission. Available in HSTS as of version 3.6.0. /events/{id} is available in HSTS as of version 3.7.3.

tags.name: /files/{id}
tags.description: Create, modify, and delete files, symbolic links, and directories on a node. Requires access key or bearer token authentication. Bearer token users are restricted to the tenant space that is defined in the bearer token and by the permissions set on the files. Available in HSTS as of version 3.6.0. /files/{id}/content is available in HSTS as of version 3.7.3.

tags.name: /files/{uri_encoded_path}/contents
tags.description: 'List the contents of the specified file with the uri encoded path relative to the docroot. Content cannot be returned for symbolic links or directories. The maximum size being returned is 4096 bytes.'

tags.name: /files/{id}/filelock
tags.description: This API is deprecated from HSTS/HSTE 4.4.0 and will be removed in a future release. Manage filelocks on files (add, modify, delete, or revert the file to its pre-filelock state). Requires access key or bearer token authentication. Bearer token users are restricted to the tenant space that is defined in the bearer token and by the permissions set on the files. Available in HSTS as of version 3.7.3.

tags.name: /files/browse
tags.description: Retrieve metadata about the contents of the specified directory. Does not accept bearer token authentication; use /files/{id}/files instead. Available in HSTS as of version 3.6.0.

tags.name: /files/page
tags.description: Retrieve metadata about the contents of the specified directory by paging through with iteration tokens. Does not accept bearer token authentication; use /files/{id}/files instead. Available in HSTS as of version 4.0.

tags.name: /files/create
tags.description: Create directories, files, and symbolic links. Does not accept bearer token authentication; use /files/{id} instead. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0. On Unix-like OSes, if you want to allow /files/create to set the owner of the created files and directories, run the following command: 'asconfigurator -x "set_node_data;group_ownership,-"' Otherwise, when a group ID is set on a parent directory, files and directories and that are created in the parent directory by using /files/create have the primary group ID of the user rather than the group ID of the parent directory.

tags.name: /files/delete
tags.description: Delete the specified paths and directories. Does not accept bearer token authentication; use /files/{id} instead. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0.

tags.name: /files/download_setup
tags.description: FASP transfers can use transfer tokens to authorize a specific download. Transfer tokens are the most restrictive of the tokens and require careful configuration. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0.

tags.name: /files/filelock
tags.description: This API is deprecated from HSTS/HSTE 4.4.0 and will be removed in a future release. Apply filelocks on files by file path. To remove a filelock, use /files/unfilelock. Does not accept bearer token authentication; to manage filelocks using bearer token authorization or get the filelock status of a file, use /files/{id}/filelock. Available in HSTS as of version 3.8.0.

tags.name: /files/info
tags.description: Get metadata for the files and directories that are specified in an array of paths. Does not accept bearer token authentication; use /files/{id} instead. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0.

tags.name: /files/rename
tags.description: Rename the specified files and directories. Existing files and directories cannot be overwritten by a /files/rename request. Does not accept bearer token authentication; use /files/{id} instead. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0.

tags.name: /files/search
tags.description: Search for objects in a specified path that match user-specified conditions and terms. Does not accept bearer token authentication. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0.

tags.name: /files/unfilelock
tags.description: This API is deprecated from HSTS/HSTE 4.4.0 and will be removed in a future release. Remove filelocks on files by file path. To add a filelock, use /files/filelock. Does not accept bearer token authentication; to manage filelocks using bearer token authorization or get the filelock status of a file, use /files/{id}/filelock. Available in HSTS as of version 3.8.0.

tags.name: /files/upload_setup
tags.description: FASP transfers can use transfer tokens to authorize a specific upload. Transfer tokens are the most restrictive of the tokens and require careful configuration. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0.

tags.name: /info
tags.description: Get information about the node set up and capabilities. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0.

tags.name: /ops/transfers
tags.description: Start and manage transfers between Aspera nodes including streaming transfers. Authentication with an access key or Node API credentials allows you to start a transfer of any content in the tenant space (as allowed by the storage path in the access key or, for HSTS and AOD, by the node user's file restriction or docroot). You can get information about, modify, and cancel any transfers in the same tenant space. Authentication with a bearer token restricts you to the tenant space defined by the bearer token and the permissions on the content. Note: Node users in HSTS versions 3.6.0 through 3.6.5 have full access to start, list, and stop all transfers.

tags.name: /permissions
tags.description: Create and manage file permissions and access levels for Node API users who authenticate with bearer tokens. Access key users, access key owners, and other admin users have all access levels permissions. Each permission includes a user or group ID and access levels (file actions such as list, read, and delete). Permission access levels apply recursively and cumulatively; once a user has a certain access level to a directory, they have at least that level of access to all children. An access level permission allows the user to give or remove the same permission to others. Available in HSTS as of version 3.6.0.

tags.name: /ping
tags.description: Test the responsiveness of a node. Available in HSTS as of version 3.0.0.

tags.name: /self
tags.description: For access key and bearer token users, get metadata for the access key that is used to authenticate the request. Equivalent to sending a request to /access_keys/self.

tags.name: /space
tags.description: For High-Speed Transfer Server nodes and Aspera on Demand, get the total and available space for the file system, drives or partitions (logical or physical) that host one or more queried paths. Available in HSTS as of version 3.6.0.

tags.name: /streams
tags.description: This endpoint is deprecated and will be removed, please use /ops/transfers with use_ascp4 for streaming transfers.

tags.name: /usage
tags.description: Retrieve usage data, as bytes transferred in, bytes transferred out, and total, listed by usage ID. The usage ID is a user-defined tag that is configured as part of the transfer request, either in an /ops/transfers request body or on the ascp command line. You can also retrieve usage data for a specific usage ID. Usage information (usage ID and bytes transferred) is not available until the FASP transfer gracefully terminates (completes or errors). If the FASP transfer is stopped abruptly, no usage information is retained. To get transfer rates for a specific transfer as time series data, use /ops/transfers/bandwidth. Authentication with Node API credentials allows you to retrieve usage for the node user. If an access key is also provided as a query, the response is the same as for access key authentication. Authentication with a master access key ID and secret allows you to retrieve usage associated with the access key, including usage by all usage IDs, aggregate usage for the access key and any sub-access keys, and usage by access key (for sub-access keys). Authentication with a sub-access key allows you to retrieve only usage data associated with the sub-access key (no data by usage IDs or aggregate data). Authentication with a bearer token allows you to retrieve usage data for the associated access key only if the bearer token has an admin scope-role. Bearer tokens with user scope-role cannot access /usage. Available in HSTS as of version 3.7.2.

parameters.description: For versions 3.6.0 through 3.7.4, to return storage information set the value as "storage" and to return license information set the value as "license". These can be combined to return both sets of information; for example: `https://{domain}:9092/access_keys/{id}?embed%5b%5d=storage&embed%5b%5d=license`. As of 3.8.0, license and storage information is automatically included in the response.

get.summary: Get event information for the node
get.description: Get a full or filtered list of node events to which the user has access.

parameters.name: X-Aspera-AccessKey
parameters.description: Required only for bearer token authorization. The access key ID used to create the bearer token; value is the access key ID.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Required for basic token or bearer token authorization. Value is the token string as "Basic {token_string}" or "Bearer {token_string}".

parameters.name: after_time
parameters.description: Get events that occurred after the specified time, in ISO format (for example, 2015-09-11T23:53:40Z). If both "after_time" and "iteration_token" are specified, the most recent of those two attributes is used to determine which events are returned in the response.

parameters.name: iteration_token
parameters.description: Get events that occurred after the specified iteration token. The iteration token defines a specific time in the log; it is generated by a previous request and returned in the LINK header. The same iteration token is reported to different applications as long as they are querying the same server.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Get no more than the specified number of events. If the number of events exceed the value for "count", then the oldest events are returned. Calling /events again with the returned HTTP link header returns the next oldest set.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Get events that match the type and subtype. Only one "type" can be specified at a time. To retrieve multiple types, use a glob pattern as a value for "type_glob[]". If no types are specified, all event types are returned. File event types are "file.created", "file.deleted", "file.modified", and "file.moved". Permission event types are "permission.created", "permission.edited", "permission.deleted", "permission.modified", "file.filelock.created" (available as of 3.7.4), "file.filelock.modified" (available as of 3.7.4), "file.filelock.deleted" (available as of 3.7.4), and "file.filelock.reverted" (available as of 3.7.4). Transfer event types are "download.started", "upload.started", "transfer.started" (returns both "download.started" and "upload.started"), "download.ended", "upload.ended", and "transfer.ended" (returns both "download.ended" and "upload.ended").

parameters.name: type_glob[ ]
parameters.description: Get events that match the glob pattern, in which an asterisk ("*") is a wildcard for all available subtypes. Note: You can include only  one glob pattern in a request, so if you need information for both "file.*" and "permission.*" events, for example, you must make two separate calls to the endpoint.

Link.description: A URL to the next set of items that match the current request.

500.description: Internal Server Error

get.description: Get the event information for a specific event. User must have access to the event to get information.

post.description: Create a zero or non-zero byte file, symbolic link, or directory in the directory that is specified by ID. Specify the object characteristics in the request body. Bearer token users must have "write" permission (recursively) on the directory to create files or links, and "mkdir" permission to create directories. The non-zero file size is limited by max_request_file_create_size_kb server configuration char_device_file type cannot be created.

parameters.description: Required only for bearer token authorization. The access key ID used to create the bearer token; value is the access key ID.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Required for basic token or bearer token authorization. Value is the token string as "Basic {token_string}" or "Bearer {token_string}".

parameters.name: id

get.summary: List metadata for files in a directory
get.description: List the metadata of files in the specified directory (IDs of links and folders are not supported). Bearer token users must have "list" permission (recursively) on the directory, and "admin" permissions to view file paths.

parameters.name: X-Aspera-AccessKey
parameters.description: Required only for bearer token authorization. The access key ID used to create the bearer token; value is the access key ID.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Required for basic token or bearer token authorization. Value is the token string as "Basic {token_string}" or "Bearer {token_string}".

parameters.name: Accept-version
parameters.description: Header 'Accept-version: 4.0' is newly introduced since HSTS 4.0, it improves the file browse performance without loading everything in and being able to do global sort and filter, so with this header, query parameters sort, min_size, max_size, min_modified_time, max_modified_time, target_id, target_node_id, files_prefetch_count, page, name_iglob are no longer supported.

parameters.name: iteration_token
parameters.description: The iteration token to explore the current page. For the first page, this is not required, and the next page token will be returned in the header 'X-Aspera-Next-Iteration-Token'. This is used when header 'Accept-version' is present.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Return the metadata of files in the directory as pages and for the specified page number.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Return the metadata for the specified number of files on each page.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Include the specified attributes in the metadata. Values are "access_levels", "recursive_counts", and "filelocked_file_ids".

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the files by the specified attribute. Sortable attributes are "name", "size", "type", "modified_time", "recursive_folder_count", "recursive_link_count", "recursive_file_count", or "recursive_size".

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter files by file name. Use this option to return metadata for a specific file.

parameters.name: name_glob
parameters.description: Filter files by name using glob patterns that are case sensitive, such as "*.TXT".

parameters.name: name_iglob
parameters.description: Filter files by name using glob patterns that are case insensitive, such as "*.txt".

parameters.name: min_size
parameters.description: Filter files by size, returning metadata only for files that are larger than the specified value (in bytes).

parameters.name: max_size
parameters.description: Filter files by size, returning metadata only for files that are smaller than the specified value (in bytes).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter files by type. Value is "file", "link", or "folder".

parameters.name: min_modified_time
parameters.description: Filter files by modified time, returning metadata only for files that were modified after the specified time. Time in ISO format.

parameters.name: max_modified_time
parameters.description: Filter files by modified time, returning metadata only for files that were modified before the specified time. Time in ISO format.

parameters.name: target_id
parameters.description: Filter files by target ID.

parameters.name: target_node_id
parameters.description: Filter files by the ID of the node on which the symbolic link target is located.

Access-Control-Expose-Headers.description: A list of access control headers that are returned in the response. For example, X-Aspera-Node-Cache, X-Total-Count, X-Aspera-Next-Iteration-Token

X-Aspera-Node-Cache.description: Information about the node cache for debugging purposes.

X-Total-Count.description: The number of items for which metadata is returned. For example,  X-Total-Count: 2

X-Aspera-Next-Iteration-Token.description: The next iteration token that can be used to explore the next page. This is returned when header 'Accept-version' is used.

parameters.name: Accept-version
parameters.description: Header 'Accept-version: 4.0' is newly introduced since HSTS 4.4 for GET /files/{id}?ajq_id=, with this header present, the delete job status can be requested with the parameter ajq_id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the file, symbolic link, or directory

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Include the specified attributes in the metadata. Value is "access_levels", "permission_count", "recursive_counts".

parameters.name: ajq_id
parameters.description: the delete job id from the response of DELETE /files/{id}

parameters.name: stop
parameters.description:
To cancel/abort a delete job: stop=cancel: request job be cancelled. Node executing job will attempt to
        cancel job if it has not been started. Resulting status will
        either be canceled or might end up completing if not stopped
        in time
stop=abort:  try to stop job even if it has started execution, leaving
        result in an indeterminate state. Job handler may or may not
        be written to attempt this operation. If not, it will be
        ignored. If job has not yet started execution, job status
        will be returned as cancelled.

202.description: With the header 'Accept-version: 4.0' present, 202 will be returned with a response body including the job status.

post.description: This operation is deprecated from HSTS/HSTE 4.4.0 and will be removed in a future release. Apply a filelock to a file that prevents other users from modifying the file, unless they are admins, in which case they can override the filelock. The filelock creates a backup of the original file as `.file.asp-bak` and a metadata file, `.file.asp-lck`, that contains the name of the user who locked the file. Bearer token users must have recursive "read", "write", and "delete" permissions on the file. Does not support non-files (folders or links).

put.description: This operation is deprecated from HSTS/HSTE 4.4.0 and will be removed in a future release. Modify a filelock on a file by changing the tags or the status. The user must have created the filelock, or bearer token users must have recursive "read", "write", and "delete" permissions on the file. To revert a file to its state before the filelock was applied, either use a PUT /files/{id}/filelock request with the status value set to "reverted", or use a REVERT /files/{id}/filelock request.

delete.description: This operation is deprecated from HSTS/HSTE 4.4.0 and will be removed in a future release. Delete the filelock on a file, including the file backup and metadata files. The user must have created the filelock, or bearer token users must have recursive "read", "write", and "delete" permissions on the file. Once a filelock is deleted, the file cannot be reverted to the original file as it was before the filelock was applied. To revert a file to its state before the filelock was applied, either use a PUT /files/{id}/filelock request with the status value set to "reverted", or use a REVERT /files/{id}/filelock request.

get.summary: Get Information about transfers (all or filtered)
get.description: Retrieve information about transfers to which you have access. The response can be filtered and sorted. To retrieve information about transfers that were started with Faspex or the Connect Server web UI, use the Reliable Query API. To retrieve bandwidth data, use /ops/transfers/bandwidth.

parameters.name: X-Aspera-AccessKey
parameters.description: Required only for bearer token authorization. The access key ID used to create the bearer token; value is the access key ID.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Required for basic token or bearer token authorization. Value is the token string as "Basic {token_string}" or "Bearer {token_string}".

parameters.name: Origin
parameters.description: Use this header to simulate CORS and permit access to the specified HTTP resource. The response includes headers to support CORS.

parameters.name: after_time
parameters.description: Get transfers for which at least one event happened (sessions in progress or terminated) after the specified time. Value is time in ISO format.

parameters.name: iteration_token
parameters.description: Get transfers after the specified iteration token. The iteration token defines a specific time in the log; it is generated by a previous request and returned in the LINK header. The same iteration token is reported to different applications as long as they are querying the same server.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Get no more than the specified number of transfers. If the number of transfers exceeds count, then the oldest count of transfer events are returned. Querying /ops/transfers again with the returned HTTP link header returns the next oldest set.

parameters.name: active_only
parameters.description: If true, get only running transfers (waiting or running). If false, get only transfers that are not running (completed or failed).

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Get only transfers that are going in the specified direction. Value is "send" or "receive".

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Filter transfers by tag. The value can use the format {key}[,{keys}...] or {key}[,{keys}...]={value}. For example, to return all transfers that have "xfer_retry" set to 10 in the tags value ("tags":{"aspera":{"xfer_retry":10}}), use "tag=aspera.xfer_retry%3D10" (where "%3D" is URL-encoded "="). To return transfers that are started with an access key (so the transfer specification includes "tags":{"aspera":{"node":{"access_key":"{access_key_id}"}}}), use "tag=aspera.node.access_key". To return transfers that are started with a specific access key, use "tag=aspera.node.access_key%3D{access_key_id}".

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Return only the specified information. Allowed values are "id" (Return only the transfer session IDs), "short_summary" (Show an abbreviated summary and session information, but do not report file data), or "summary" (Show the full summary and session information, but do not report file data).

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Get transfers that are authorized by the specified access key. This option is only allowed with node user authentication.

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: If the request included an "Origin" header, the resource specified in that header.

Access-Control-Expose-Headers.description: If the request included an "Origin" header, value is "Link".

Link.description: A URL to the next set of items that match the current request.

500.description: Internal Server Error

parameters.description: Required for basic token or bearer token authorization. Value is the token string as "Basic {token_string}" or "Bearer {token_string}".

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: Get all permissions, including inherited (recursive) permissions, for the file ID. Requires any permission (recursively) on the file. The response includes only permissions that apply to the user, unless the user has any permissions on the root file, in which case all permission are returned.

parameters.name: inherited
parameters.description: Use with "file_id" to retrieve all permissions with or without inherited (recursive) permissions. Requires any permission (recursively) on the file.

parameters.name: access_type
parameters.description: Use with "access_id" to retrieve all permissions for the given access ID. Value is "user" or "group". Returns permission information only if the user is the access ID or has any permissions to the root file. Otherwise, filters permissions by access ID.

parameters.name: access_id
parameters.description: Use with "access_type" to retrieve all permissions for the given access ID. Returns permission information only if the user is the access ID or has any permissions to the root file. Otherwise, filters permissions by access ID.

parameters.name: created_by_id
parameters.description: Retrieve all permissions for the given ID. Returns permission information only if the user is the created by ID or has any permissions to the root file. Otherwise, filters permissions by created by ID and excludes inherited permissions.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Return the permissions as pages. Use with "per_page" to set the number of permissions returned per page.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Return the specified number of permissions per page.

parameters.name: embed[]
parameters.description: Embed the file metadata in the response. Value is "file".

parameters.name: access_levels[]
parameters.description: Filter permissions by access levels. Value is "list", "read", "write", "delete", "mkdir", "rename", or "preview". Available in HSTS as of version 3.7.4. Filter by multiple access levels by using multiple queries.

parameters.name: access_level
parameters.description: Filter permissions by access level. For versions of HSTS older than 3.7.4. Value is "edit" or "view".

parameters.name: last_updated_by_id
parameters.description: Filter permissions by "last_updated_by_id" and exclude inherited permissions.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter permissions by tag and exclude inherited permissions. Value has the format *tag_id*(*tag_value*).

Access-Control-Expose-Headers.description: A list of access control headers that are returned in the response. For example, Access-Control-Expose-Headers: X-Total-Count

parameters.name: X-Aspera-AccessKey
parameters.description: Required only for bearer token authorization. The access key ID used to create the bearer token; value is the access key ID.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Required for basic token or bearer token authorization. Value is the token string as "Basic {token_string}" or "Bearer {token_string}".

parameters.description: The usage ID.

400.description: Bad Request. Request contains a formatting or syntax error.

404.description: Event logging is not enabled on the server or the usage ID is not valid.

id.description: The access key ID. If no value is provided, the Node API creates one.

token_verification_key.description: Required when the access key is used to create a bearer token, the public key corresponding to the private key that is used to create the bearer token.

files_filelock_enabled.description: If true, allow the access key user to create filelocks. Filelocks cannot be set if filelocks are disabled on the server ("files_filelock_enabled" is set to false in aspera.conf). Available as of 3.8.0.

files_filelock_restriction.description: Set to "none" to allow the access key user to write, delete, or rename files if they are not locked or if the filelock was applied by the user. Set to "write" to allow the access key user to write, delete, or rename files only if the filelock was applied by the user. Available as of 3.8.0.

type.description: The storage type. Use the value corresponding to the storage type. For local storage, set to "local". For Amazon S3, set to "aws_s3". For Azure Block and Page, set to "azure". For Azure SAS, set to "azure_sas". For Azure Files, set to "azure-files". For Google Cloud Storage, set to "google-gcs". For IBM Cloud Object Storage (COS) S3, set to "ibm-s3". If the storage type is any type other than "local", "credentials" is required.

bucket.description: Required for Amazon S3 or IBM COS S3, the storage bucket.

endpoint.description: Required for Amazon S3 and IBM COS S3, the authentication endpoint.

container.description: The Azure storage container. Required for Azure Block, Azure Page, and Azure SAS.

path.description: The path to which the user has access. For local storage - the local storage path; required if the access key is used to start transfers with /ops/transfers. For Amazon S3 - the path within the bucket (optional). For Azure Block, Page, and SAS - the path within the container (optional). For Google Cloud Storage - the bucket and path within the storage endpoint. The bucket is required, the path is optional. For IBM Cloud Object Storage (COS) S3 - the path within the bucket (optional).

storage_endpoint.description: Required for Azure Block and Azure Page storage, the authentication endpoint.

storage_class.description: For Amazon S3 storage, the type of storage. Value is "STANDARD", "REDUCED_REDUNDANCY", or "INFREQUENT_ACCESS". Default is "STANDARD".

server_side_encryption.description: For Amazon S3 storage, specify the type of server-side encryption if it is enabled on the storage. Value is "AES256" or "AWS_KMS". If "AWS_KMS", "server_side_encryption_aws_kms_key_id" is required.

server_side_encryption_aws_kms_key_id.description: Required for Amazon S3 storage with "AWS_KMS" server-side encryption, the ARN of the encryption key. For example, "arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:648543846928:key/er23525-8754-84g4-8sf7-4834ngigfre45"

api.description: Required for Azure Block, Page, and SAS, the storage API. Value is "BLOCK" or "PAGE".

max_segments_per_compose.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage, the maximum number of compose parts, which enable high-speed transfer with the storage. Set to 10000.

type.description: Required for Amazon S3, Azure Block and Page, Google Cloud Storage, and IBM COS S3 storage. The type of access credentials provided. For Amazon S3 storage, the value is "key" (requires values for "access_key_id" and "secret_access_key"), "iam-role" (requires a value for "iam_role_name"), or "assume-role" (requires values for "assume_role_arn", "assume_role_external_id", and "assume_role_session_name"). For Azure Block and Page storage, the value must be "key". For Google Cloud Storage, the value is "service_account"; "service_account" with a private key requires "private_key" and "client_email", "oauth" requires "client_id", "client_secret", "access_token", "oauth" , "refresh_token", "auth_uri", "token_uri", "auth_provider_x509_cert_url", and "client_x509_cert_url". For IBM COS S3 storage, the value must be "key".

access_key_id.description: Required for Amazon S3 storage with "key" authentication and IBM COS S3 storage, the access key ID.

secret_access_key.description: Required for Amazon S3 storage with "key" authentication and IBM COS S3 storage, the access key secret.

iam_role_name.description: Required for Amazon S3 storage with "iam-role" authentication, the IAM role name.

assume_role_arn.description:
Required for Amazon S3 storage with "assume-role" authentication, the assume role ARN, with the following format
  "arn:aws:iam::{your_aws_account_id}:role/{role_name}

assume_role_external_id.description: Required for Amazon S3 storage with "assume-role" authentication, the assume role external ID.

assume_role_session_name.description: For Amazon S3 storage with "assume-role" authentication, the assume role session name. Optional.

account.description: Required for Azure Block and Page storage, the account name.

key.description: Required for Azure Block and Page storage, the storage access key.

shared_access_signature.description: Required for Azure SAS storage, the shared URL.

file_service_endpoint.description: Required for Azure Files storage, the file service endpoint, with the following format "https://{account}.file.core.windows.net/"

password.description: Required for Azure Files storage, the password for the service endpoint.

project_id.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage, the project ID.

private_key_id.description: For Google Cloud Storage, the private key ID. Optional.

private_key.description:
Required for Google Cloud Storage with "service_account" authentication, the private key string with the format
`------BEGIN PRIVATE KEY------{key_string}------END PRIVATE KEY-----`

client_email.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "service_account" authentication, the client email with the format "{client_id}@developer.gserviceaccount.com"

client_id.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the client ID.

client_secret.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the client secret.

access_token.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the access token.

refresh_token.description: For Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the refresh token. Optional. Required only if you want to be able to refresh the access token when it expires.

token_expiration.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the number of seconds until the token expires.

auth_uri.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the authentication URL "https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/auth".

token_uri.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the token authentication URL "https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/token".

auth_provider_x509_cert_url.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the URL for the authentication provider x509 certs.

client_x509_cert_url.description: Required for Google Cloud Storage with "oauth" authentication, the URL for the client x509 certs with the format "https:www.googleapis.com/robot/v1/metadata/x509/{client_id}%40developer.gserviceaccount.com"

accessKeyGETall.description: An array of access key metadata.

root_file_id.description: The ID of the root file (the topmost storage) of the access key.

token_verification_key.description: A token key that is configured on the node and used to authenticate token bearers.

files_filelock_enabled.description: If true, allow the access key user to create filelocks. Filelocks cannot be set if filelocks are disabled on the server ("files_filelock_enabled" is set to false in aspera.conf). Available as of 3.8.0.

files_filelock_restriction.description: Set to "none" to allow the access key user to write, delete, or rename files if they are not locked or if the filelock was applied by the user. Set to "write" to allow the access key user to write, delete, or rename files only if the filelock was applied by the user. Available as of 3.8.0.

cipher.description: The encryption mode (CFB or GCM) and minimum cipher key length allowed by the server for transfers that are authorized by this access key. Value is "none", "aes-128", "aes-192", "aes-256", "aes-128-cfb", "aes-192-cfb", "aes-256-cfb", "aes-128-gcm", "aes-192-gcm", "aes-256-gcm". Default is unset, such that the transfer authorized by the access key must respect the server configuration. Available as of 3.8.0; values "aes-XXX-cfb" and "aes-XXX-gcm" are supported as of 3.9.0. See the HST Server 3.9.0 Admin guide for important client-server cipher compatibility information.

policy.description: The policy allowed for transfers that are authorized by this access key. Value is "high", "regular", "fair", "low", "trickle", or "fixed". Aspera recommends against setting the policy to fixed, which can result in the transfer rate exceeding network or storage capacity if the client also requests a high minimum transfer rate that is not capped by the server. This can decrease transfer performance and cause problems on the target storage. To avoid these problems, set the allowed policy to fair. Available as of 3.8.0.

target_rate_kbps.description: The default initial rate for transfers that are authorized by this access key, in kilobits per second. Available as of 3.8.0.

target_rate_cap_kbps.description: The maximum target rate for transfers that are authorized by this access key, in kilobits per second. Available as of 3.8.0.

content_protection_secret.description: Provide a password to require that content be encrypted by the client (enforce client-side encryption-at-rest) for transfers that are authorized by this access key, once set, it is not allowed to be changed via PUT. Available as of 3.8.0.

preserve_timestamps.description: If true, preserve file access and modification timestamps for transfers that are authorized by this access key. The server configuration overrides the access key configuration. Timestamp support in object storage varies by provider; consult your object storage documentation to determine which settings are supported. Default is unset, such that the access key inherits the server configuration.  Available as of 3.8.0.

aggressiveness.description: The aggressiveness of transfers that are authorized by this access key in claiming available bandwidth. Value is 0.00-1.00. Available as of 3.8.0.

token_encryption_key.description: The secret key being used to generate ATM tokens.

byok_enabled.description: If true, the Bring Your Own Key is enabled. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

bandwidth_flow_network_rc_module.description: Incoming/Outgoing Rate Control Module, values can be delay, delay-odp, delay-adv or delay-laq. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

cipher.description: The encryption mode (CFB or GCM) and minimum cipher key length allowed by the server for transfers that are authorized by this access key. Value is "none", "aes-128", "aes-192", "aes-256", "aes-128-cfb", "aes-192-cfb", "aes-256-cfb", "aes-128-gcm", "aes-192-gcm", "aes-256-gcm". Default is unset, such that the transfer authorized by the access key must respect the server configuration. Available as of 3.8.0; values "aes-XXX-cfb" and "aes-XXX-gcm" are supported as of 3.9.0.

policy.description: The policy allowed for transfers that are authorized by this access key. Value is "high", "regular", "fair", "low", "trickle", or "fixed". Aspera recommends against setting the policy to fixed, which can result in the transfer rate exceeding network or storage capacity if the client also requests a high minimum transfer rate that is not capped by the server. This can decrease transfer performance and cause problems on the target storage. To avoid these problems, set the allowed policy to fair. Available as of 3.8.0.

target_rate_kbps.description: The default initial rate for transfers that are authorized by this access key, in kilobits per second. Available as of 3.8.0.

target_rate_cap_kbps.description: The maximum target rate for transfers that are authorized by this access key, in kilobits per second. Available as of 3.8.0.

preserve_timestamps.description: If true, preserve file access and modification timestamps for transfers that are authorized by this access key. The server configuration overrides the access key configuration. Timestamp support in object storage varies by provider; consult your object storage documentation to determine which settings are supported. Default is unset, such that the access key inherits the server configuration.  Available as of 3.8.0.

aggressiveness.description: The aggressiveness of transfers that are authorized by this access key in claiming available bandwidth. Value is 0.00-1.00. Available as of 3.8.0.

activity_event_logging.description: If true, allow the Node API to query transfers that are associated with this access key through the /events endpoint. The access key configuration overrides the server configuration. This option must be enabled for event reporting to IBM Aspera on Cloud. Default is unset, such that the access key inherits the server configuration.  Available as of 3.8.0.

recursive_counts.description: If true, enable recursive counts. This option must be enabled for event reporting to IBM Aspera on Cloud. The access key configuration overrides the server configuration. Default is unset, such that the access key inherits the server configuration. Available as of 3.8.0.

aej_logging.description: If true, enable reporting to the IBM Aspera on Cloud Activity app. The access key configuration overrides the server configuration. Default is unset (access key inherits the value set in the server's aspera.conf). Available as of 3.9.0.

activity_files_max.description: Maximum number of files to log per transfer via the reporting engine. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

access_key_credentials_encryption_type.description: The encryption algorithm to encrypt the storage credential, content_protection_secret and token_encryption_key, currently aes-128-gcm is supported. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

wss_enabled.description: If true, enable the web socket transfer service. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

activity_transfer_ignore_skipped_files.description: If true, skipped files won't be reported in the /ops/transfers. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

token_verification_key.description: A token key that is configured on the node and used to authenticate token bearers.

files_filelock_enabled.description: If true, allow the access key user to create filelocks. Filelocks cannot be set if filelocks are disabled on the server ("files_filelock_enabled" is set to false in aspera.conf). Available as of 3.8.0.

files_filelock_restriction.description: Set to "none" to allow the access key user to write, delete, or rename files if they are not locked or if the filelock was applied by the user. Set to "write" to allow the access key user to write, delete, or rename files only if the filelock was applied by the user. Available as of 3.8.0.

status.description:
The current status of the job:
  * `waiting` - job as been submitted to the job queue, waiting for an execution
     node to take it.
  * `running` - job is assigned to an execution node and is either in start
     delay (see above) or executing.
  * `complete` - job completed successfully
  * `ncomplete` - job completed on more than one node (this is an configuration
     error, job_timeout_ms was too low, another node took job
     assuming first execution node had failed)
  * `cancelled` - job was stopped by user before it began executing
  * `aborted` - job was stopped by user after it began executing
  * `error` - error executing job

For downloads, either a value must be provided for "source_root" or at least one "source" must be set in "paths". content_protection.description: Enable content protection (encryption-at-rest), which encrypts files when they are uploaded to the server and decrypts files when they are downloaded. Allowed values:  encrypt: Encrypt transferred files (on the server). decrypt: Decrypt downloaded files. If content_protection_password is not specified, Connect will prompt for the passphrase.  Default: decrypt

Allowed values:  high: When sharing bandwidth, transfer at twice the rate of a transfer using a fair policy. fair (default value): Share bandwidth equally with other traffic. low: Use only un-utilized bandwidth. fixed: Transfer at the target rate, regardless of the actual network capacity. Do not share bandwidth. The fixed policy can decrease transfer performance and cause problems on the target storage.

target_rate_kbps.description: The desired speed of the transfer, in Kbps. If there is competing network traffic, FASP shares this bandwidth, depending on the "rate_policy". Default is set on the server in the configuration file (aspera.conf). Will respect both local- and server-side target rate caps if set. Must be provided when you set a value for "target_rate_cap_kbps".

The path name that was queried.

bytes_total.description: The total space in bytes of the mount point of the path.

bytes_free.description: The free space in bytes of the mount point of the path.

percent_free.description: The percentage of the total space that is available.

transferPostRequest.description: The request body for a transfer.

remote_host.description: IP or fully qualified domain name of the remote server.

remote_password.description: The password for the remote transfer user. Available as of 3.6.1. Aspera recommends using SSH private keys instead of passwords.

ssh_private_key.description: The contents of the transfer user's SSH private key. Available as of 3.7.2. Required when you authenticate the transfer using SSH public/priavte key pair. The contents should be formatted into a single line string and include the header and footer (i.e., "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\nXXXXXXXXX\n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----").

ssh_private_key_passphrase.description: The passphrase associated with the transfer user's SSH private key. Available as of 3.7.2.

remote_access_key.description: The access key ID of the access key that was used to construct the bearer token that is used to authenticate to the remote node.

token.description: The token that authorizes access to the storage. The token can be a basic token (value is "Basic {token_string}"), bearer token (value is "Bearer {token_string}"), or transfer token (value is "{token_string}").

source_root_id.description: The file ID of the source root directory. Required when using Bearer token auth for the source node.

destination_root_id.description: The file ID of the destination root directory. Required when using Bearer token auth for the destination node.

source_root.description: The pathname of the source root directory. Not supported when using Bearer token auth for the source node.

destination_root.description: The pathname of the destination root directory. Not supported when using Bearer token auth for the destination node.

ssh_port.description: The port that is used for the SSH connection.

fasp_port.description: The port that is used for data transfer.

http_fallback.description: If true, HTTP fallback attempts to perform an HTTP or HTTPS transfer when a FASP transfer cannot be performed. Default: false.

http_fallback_port.description: The port that is used for HTTP fallback transfers. Default is 443 if a cipher is enabled, 80 otherwise.

https_fallback_port.description: The port that is used for HTTPS fallback transfers. Default is 443 if a cipher is enabled, 80 otherwise.

cipher.description: The encryption algorithm that is used to encrypt data in transit. Allowed values are "none" ("none" means use the remote server configuration or the ascp default of aes-128, it does not mean "do not encrypt"), "aes-128", "aes-192", "aes-256", "aes-128-cfb", "aes-192-cfb", "aes-256-cfb", "aes-128-gcm", "aes-192-gcm", or "aes-256-gcm". Default: "aes-128". "aes-192" and "aes-256" available as of 3.8.0. "aes-XXX-gcm" and "aes-XXX-cfb" supported as of 3.9.0 and require client and server 3.9.0 or newer. See the HST Server 3.9.0 Admin guide for important client-server cipher compatibility information.

content_protection.description: 'Enable client-side content protection (encryption-at-rest). For uploads, set to "encrypt" to transfer encrypted files and store them on the server with the extension ".aspera-env". To download and decrypt encrypted files, set to "decrypt". If "content_protection_password" is not specified, Connect prompts for the passphrase. Default: "decrypt".'

content_protection_password.description: The passphrase for the client-side encryption-at-rest action, if any.

cookie.description: Data to associate with the transfer. The cookie is reported to both client-side and server-side applications that are monitoring FASP transfers. Cookies are often used by applications to identify associated transfers.

rate_policy.description: The transfer rate policy to use when sharing bandwidth. Value is: "high" (when sharing bandwidth, transfer at twice the rate of a transfer using a fair policy), "fair" (default, share bandwidth equally with other traffic), "low" (use only unused bandwidth),  "fixed" (transfer at the target rate, regardless of the actual network capacity and do not share bandwidth). Aspera recommends that you do not use "fixed" except under special circumstances, otherwise the destination storage can be damaged.

symlink_policy.description: Handle symbolic links using the specified method, as allowed by the server. Available as of 3.7.4. Value is: "follow" (default, follow a symbolic link and transfer the contents of the linked file or directory as long as the link target is in the user's docroot), "copy" (copy only the symbolic link. If a file with the same name exists at the destination, the symbolic link does not replace the file. If the server symbolic link handling configuration in aspera.conf does not include "create", then symbolic links are skipped (the default server configuration is "create,follow").), "copy+force" (copy only the symbolic link. If a file with the same name exists at the destination, the symbolic link replaces the file. If the file of the same name at the destination is a symbolic link to a directory, it is not replaced. If the server symbolic link handling configuration in aspera.conf does not include "create", then symbolic links are skipped (the default server configuration is "create,follow").), "skip" (skip symbolic links. Neither the link nor the file to which it points are transferred. This is the only option allowed when the transfer destination is a Windows server).

target_rate_kbps.description: The target rate for the transfer, in Kbps. If there is competing network traffic, FASP may share this bandwidth, depending on the "rate_policy" value you set. Default is the target rate default value in the local server's configuration file (aspera.conf). Respects both local- and remote target rate caps, if set. Must be provided when you set a value for "target_rate_cap_kbps".

target_rate_cap_kbps.description: Upper limit of target rate, in Kbps. Default is no limit.

overwrite.description: The overwrite policy when source and destination files have the same name. Value is: "never" (never overwrite a destination file), "always" (always overwrite a destination file), "diff" (overwrite the destination file if it is different from the source file), "older" (overwrite the destination file if its timestamp is older than the source file), or "diff+older" (overwrite the destination file it is older and different from the source file.

resume_policy.description: The resume policy for partially transferred files. Value is:  "none" (transfer the entire file again), "attrs" (resume transfer if the attributes of the source and the partial files match), "sparse_csum" (resume transfer if the attributes and sparse (fast) checksums of the source and partial files match), or "full_csum" (resume transfer if the attributes and full checksums of the source and partial files match). Note - Calculating full checksums of large files takes a long time and requires more CPU. Default is "sparse_csum"

create_dir.description: If true, create directories on the destination if they don't exist. When enabling this option, the destination path is assumed to be a directory path.

precalculate_job_size.description: If true, calculate the job size before transfer. If you are transferring a large number of files this can take a long time. Precalculating job size gives better feedback regarding the percent of the transfer that has completed. Default is false.

use_ascp4.description: If true, transfer with ascp4 instead of ascp. Default is false. Available as of 3.8.0. Usage notes - 1) ascp4 does not prepend the docroot to the source file. For source paths, specify the full path to the source file. 2) ascp4 does not support values for *destination*. To specify a destination directory, use "destination_root_id". 3) ascp4 does not support all of the same transfer options as ascp. For a complete comparison, see the IBM Aspera High-Speed Transfer Server Admin Guide.

delete_source.description: If true, remove empty directories and the source after they are successfully transferred. Default is false.

delete_before_transfer.description: If true, delete any files that exist at the destination but not at the source before transfer. Default is false.

move_after_transfer.description: The relative path to which the files will be moved after the transfer at the source side. Available as of 3.8.0.

remove_after_transfer.description: If true, remove source files, but not their parent directory, after they are successfully transferred. Default is false. This is useful for workflows in which once a file is transferred it is no longer needed at the source.

remove_empty_directories.description: If true, remove empty directories after the files within them are successfully transferred. Default is false.

preserve_times.description: Preserve file timestamps. Default is false. Available as of 3.8.0.

preserve_access_time.description: If true, preserve file access time from the source to the destination.

preserve_modification_time.description: If true, preserve file modification time from the source to the destination.

preserve_creation_time.description: If true, preserve file creation time from the source to the destination. Only Windows systems retain information about creation time.

preserve_file_owner_uid.description: If true, preserve the user identifier from the source to the destination.

preserve_file_owner_gid.description: If true, preserve the group identifier from the source to the destination.

exclude_older_than.description: Exclude files, but not directories, from the transfer if they are older than the specified time. Time is specified as number of seconds after the source computer's epoch. Available as of 3.8.0.

exclude_newer_than.description: Exclude files, but not directories, from the transfer if they are newer than the specified time. Time is specified as number of seconds after the source computer's epoch. Available as of 3.8.0.

preserve_xattrs.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the extended attributes

remote_preserve_xattrs.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the extended attributes

preserve_acls.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the access control lists

remote_preserve_acls.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the access control lists

multi_session.description: The number of simultaneous transfer sessions allowed.

multi_session_threshold.description: The file size above which files are split across sessions.

wss_enabled.description: If true, enables a websocket transfer in lieu of SSH.

wss_cert_auth_path.description: The optional pathname of the certificate authority file for websocket enabled transfer.

proxy.description: The URL of the proxy server with the format dnat[s]://{proxy_username}:{proxy_password}@{ip_address}[:{port}]. By default, the DNAT port is 9091 and the DNATS port is 9092.

remove_skipped.description: Must also have remove_after_transfer set to true, Defaults to false, if true, skipped files will be removed as well.

file_checksum.description: It can be one of: none, sha-512, sha-384, sha-256, sha1, md5.  Calculate and record file hash values using the specified hash function. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

src_base.description: Specify the prefix to be stripped off from each source object.  The remaining portion of the source path is kept intact at the destination. Special care must be taken when used with cloud storage.

compression.description: Compress file data inline. Default: lz4.  If set to zlib, --compression-hint can be used to set the compression level, only available with use_ascp4 set to true.

dgram_size.description: The datagram size that is used for the transfer, as configured in aspera.conf on the server.

min_rate_kbps.description: The minimum transfer rate, in Kbps.

read_threads.description: Number of storage "read" threads (sender only).  Default 2, only available when use_ascp4 is true

write_threads.description: Number of storage "write" threads (receiver only).  Default 2. For transfers to object or HDFS storage, write threads cannot exceed the maximum number of jobs that are configured for Trapd. Default 15, only available when use_ascp4 is true.

transferPutRequest.description: The transfer settings that can be modified for an active transfer.

status.description: The new value for the status. To cancel a transfer, set to "canceled", "cancelled", or "stopped". To pause a transfer, set to "paused". To resume a paused transfer, set to "running" or "resume".

target_rate_kbps.description: The new target transfer rate, in Kbps.

min_rate_kbps.description: The new minimum transfer rate, in Kbps.

rate_policy.description: The new rate policy to apply to the transfer. Allowed values are "fixed", "high", "fair", or "low".

transferRequestAspera.description: Tags added by Aspera applications or the Node API user.

usage_id.description: Assign a usage ID to the transfer in order to query transfer usage (bytes transferred) with the /usage endpoint.

transferResponseSpec.description: The transfer metadata returned for a transfer.

title.description: Name of the transfer, if any.

cookie.description: The cookie generated by the application or provided in the POST request.

remote_host.description: IP or fully qualified domain name of the remote server.

remote_access_key.description: Remote access key for the transfer.

destination_root.description: The file ID of the destination root directory.

ssh_port.description: The port that is used for the SSH connection.

content_protection.description: The client-side encryption-at-rest action, encrypt or decrypt.

content_protection_password.description: The passphrase for the client-side encryption-at-rest action, if any.

precalculate_job_size.description: If true, calculate the job size before transfer.

delete_source.description: If true, remove empty directories and the source after they are successfully transferred.

remove_after_transfer.description: If true, remove source files, but not their parent directory, after they are successfully transferred.

remove_empty_directories.description: If true, remove empty directories after the files within them are successfully transferred.

multi_session_threshold.description: The file size, in bytes, above which files are split across sessions.

file_checksum.description: It can be one of: none, sha-512, sha-384, sha-256, sha1, md5.  Calculate and record file hash values using the specified hash function. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

src_base.description: Specify the prefix to be stripped off from each source object.  The remaining portion of the source path is kept intact at the destination. Special care must be taken when used with cloud storage.

delete_before_transfer.description: If true, delete any files that exist at the destination but not at the source before transfer.

preserve_access_time.description: If true, preserve file access time from the source to the destination.

preserve_modification_time.description: If true, preserve file modification time from the source to the destination.

preserve_creation_time.description: If true, preserve file creation time from the source to the destination. Only Windows systems retain information about creation time.

preserve_file_owner_uid.description: If true, preserve the user identifier from the source to the destination.

preserve_file_owner_gid.description: If true, preserve the group identifier from the source to the destination.

preserve_xattrs.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the extended attributes

remote_preserve_xattrs.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the extended attributes

preserve_acls.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the access control lists

remote_preserve_acls.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the access control lists

use_ascp4.description: If true, transfer with ascp4 instead of ascp.

transferResponseSessionSpec.description: The transfer session metadata returned for a transfer.

id.description: Unique ID of the transfer (same as "id").

status.description: The status of the transfer. Possible transfer states: "waiting", "running", "completed", "failed", "partially_completed", "canceled", or "paused".

bytes_transferred.description: The total number of bytes transferred across all sessions.

bytes_written.description: The total number of bytes written across all sessions.

bytes_lost.description: The total number of bytes lost across all sessions.

avg_rate_kbps.description: The average transfer rate across all sessions.

files_completed.description: The number of files that are transferred across all sessions.

directories_completed.description: The number of directories that are transferred across all sessions.

start_time_usec.description: The start time of the transfer sessions, relative to the server's epoch.

end_time_usec.description: The time when all transfer sessions complete, relative to the server's epoch.

elapsed_usec.description: The total microseconds for all transfer sessions to complete.

error_code.description: The error code for any transfer session.

error_desc.description: The error description for any transfer session.

transferResponseAspera.description: Tags added by Aspera applications or the user.

usage_id.description: Assign a usage ID to the transfer in order to query transfer usage (bytes transferred) with the /usage endpoint.

cookie.description: The cookie generated by the application or provided in the POST request.

client_token_user_id.description: If the local node provides a token, the username associated with the token.

server_token_user_id.description: If the remote node provides a token, the username associated with the token.

client_access_key.description: The access key ID of the access key that is provided to the local node, if any.

server_access_key.description: The access key ID of the access key that is provided to the remote node, if any.

endpoint.description: If the transfer direction is "send", value is "client". If the transfer direction is "recv", value is "server".

token_type.description: The token type, values can be "none", "unset", "error", "basic_token", "bearer_token", "auth_token", "access_key_auth_token". This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

remote_host.description: IP or fully qualified domain name of the remote server.

fasp_port.description: The port that is used for data transfer.

ssh_port.description: The port that is used for the SSH connection.

dgram_size.description: The datagram size that is used for the transfer, as configured in aspera.conf on the server.

wss_enabled.description: If true, enable the web socket transfer service. This is introduced in HSTS 4.0.

number_of_parts.description: number of parts for a multi_session transfer

rate_policy.description: The rate policy of the transfer.

target_rate_kbps.description: The target rate for the transfer, in Kbps.

vlink_id.description: The ID of the virtual link (bandwidth control) that is applied to the transfer.

cipher.description: The encryption algorithm that is used to encrypt data in transit.

keepalive.description: If true, transfer in persistent mode.

http_fallback.description: If true, HTTP fallback attempts to perform an HTTP or HTTPS transfer when a FASP transfer cannot be performed. Default is false.

http_fallback_port.description: The port that is used for HTTP fallback transfers. Default is 443 if a cipher is enabled, 80 otherwise.

https_fallback_port.description: The port that is used for HTTPS fallback transfers. Default is 443 if a cipher is enabled, 80 otherwise.

proxy.description: The URL of the proxy server with the format dnat[s]://{proxy_username}:{proxy_password}@{ip_address}[:{port}]. By default, the DNAT port is 9091 and the DNATS port is 9092.

create_dir.description: If true, create directories on the destination if they do not exist.

lock_target_rate.description: If true, the target transfer rate is locked by the remote node.

lock_min_rate.description: If true, the minimum transfer rate is locked by the remote node.

lock_rate_policy.description: If true, the rate policy is locked by the remote node.

target_rate_percentage.description: The target rate percentage that is set on the server.

precalc_enabled.description: If true, job size is calculated before transfer.

preserve_xattrs.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the extended attributes

remote_preserve_xattrs.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the extended attributes

preserve_acls.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the access control lists

remote_preserve_acls.description: native or metafile.  This option transfers the access control lists

source_root_id.description: The file ID of the source root directory. Required when using Bearer token auth for the source node.

destination_root_id.description: The file ID of the destination root directory. Required when using Bearer token auth for the destination node.

filters.description: List of query filters that are applied to the source paths.

client_ip_address.description: The IP address of the local node.

server_ip_address.description: The IP address of the remote node.

status.description: The status of the session. Value is "running", "completed", or "failed".

retry_timeout.description: The retry timeout set on the server.

retry_count.description: The number of retries for the session.

start_time_usec.description: Transfer session start time in microseconds since the server's epoch time.

end_time_usec.description: Transfer session start time in microseconds since the server's epoch time.

elapsed_usec.description: The duration of the transfer session, in microseconds.

bytes_transferred.description: The number of bytes transferred in the session.

bytes_written.description: The number of bytes written in the session.

bytes_lost.description: The number of bytes lost in the session.

files_completed.description: The number of files transferred in the session.

directories_completed.description: The number of directories transferred in the session.

target_rate_kbps.description: The target transfer rate for the session.

min_rate_kbps.description: The minimum transfer rate for the session.

calc_rate_kbps.description: The calculated transfer rate for the session.

avg_rate_kbps.description: The average transfer rate for the session.

error_code.description: The error code for the session, if any.

error_desc.description: A description of the session error, if any.

transferFilters.description: In order to filter directories and files to be transferred, their names are matched against patterns (globs) that include wildcards and special characters. The patterns use the standard globbing syntax found in UNIX systems as well as several Aspera extensions to the standard. Please refer to ascp man page for more details.

include.description: Include paths that match the pattern

exclude.description: Exclude paths that match the pattern

enabled.description: If true, transfer precalculation is enabled. If false, all precalculation values are reported as "0".

status.description: The status of the precalculation job.

bytes_expected.description: The number of bytes that will be transferred by the session.

directories_expected.description: The number of directories that will be transferred by the session.

files_expected.description: The number of files that will be transferred by the session.

files_excluded.description: The number of files that will be filtered from the source paths.

files_special.description: The number of files that are not ordinary files, such as symbolic links.

files_failed.description: The number of files that could not be pre-calculated.

start_time.description: The time that bandwidth data starts, in ISO format.

end_time.description: The time that bandwidth data ends, in ISO format.

max_left.description: The first value that is reported for time for the specific transfer session.

min_right.description: The last value that is reported for time for the specific transfer session.

last_time.description: The actual time for the last bandwidth data point, in ISO format.

max_rate.description: The maximum transfer rate during the reported duration, in Kbps.

time.description: The number of seconds since the start time.

id.description: The usage ID, as set in the transfer request.

bytes_in.description: The number of bytes downloaded by the usage ID.

bytes_out.description: The number of bytes uploaded by the usage ID.

bytes_total.description: The total number of bytes transferred by the usage ID.

id.description: The usage ID, as set in the transfer request.

bytes_in.description: The number of bytes downloaded by the usage ID.

bytes_out.description: The number of bytes uploaded by the usage ID.

bytes_total.description: The total number of bytes transferred by the usage ID.

HTTP Basic.description: Aspera access key, basic token, or, for requests to self-managed nodes, Node API credentials.
